intro: Satureja kochii, commonly known as Kashmir thyme, is a perennial herb native to the Himalayan regions of India and Pakistan. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, pink or purple flowers in the summer. Its leaves are fragrant and contain essential oils, making it valuable in traditional medicine and culinary uses. Satureja kochii thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
